Key Match Events: The Knicks won their ninth straight game with a score of 119-103.
Karl-Anthony Towns had a third 30-10 game with 31 points, 21 rebounds, 4 assists, a block, and a steal.
Josh Hart recorded a triple-double with 15 points, 14 rebounds, and 12 assists.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Knicks played without star guard Jalen Brunson and backup playmaker Deuce McBride.
Collin Sexton and Jordan Clarkson led the Jazz with 25 points apiece.
Others: The Knicks rose to 24-10 in the season. The Jazz, for their part, dropped to 7-25 and lost their fifth straight game.
The Knicks' next game will be against the red-hot Oklahoma City Thunder, whose 12-game winning streak is the league's longest.
